Typealiases.html#/s:9Decompose21ParseMes.name: ParseMessageGenerator
Typealiases.html#/s:9Decompose21ParseMes.abstract: A function to generate an error message.

Structs/Parser.html#/s:9Decompose6Parser.name: parse
Structs/Parser.html#/s:9Decompose6Parser.abstract: A function which takes an Input and returns a type which indicates if the Input is consumed when parsing

Structs/Parser.html#/s:9Decompose6Parser.name: flatMap(_:)
Structs/Parser.html#/s:9Decompose6Parser.abstract: Binds this Parser‘s return value to a function which generates another Parser.

Structs/Parser.html#/s:9Decompose6Parser.name: map(_:)
Structs/Parser.html#/s:9Decompose6Parser.abstract: Maps this Parser‘s value using the function parameter.

Structs/Parser.html#/s:9Decompose6Parser.name: apply(_:)
Structs/Parser.html#/s:9Decompose6Parser.abstract: Sequentially invokes this Parser, then the parameter argument, and finally invokes the second parser’s result

Structs/Parser.html#/s:9Decompose6Parser.name: or(_:)
Structs/Parser.html#/s:9Decompose6Parser.abstract: Returns a Parser which invokes this Parser, and if it fails, invokes the second Parser.

Structs/ParseMessage.html#/s:9Decompose1.name: init(position:unexpectedInput:expectedProductions:)
Structs/ParseMessage.html#/s:9Decompose1.abstract: Initializes with the current position, the unexpected Input element as a String, and the expected

Structs/ParseMessage.html#/s:9Decompose1.name: position
Structs/ParseMessage.html#/s:9Decompose1.abstract: The position in the Input for this message.

Structs/ParseMessage.html.name: ParseMessage
Structs/ParseMessage.html.abstract: Messages which can be used if the parse function is unsuccessful.

Protocols/Input.html#/s:9Decompose5Input.name: position
Protocols/Input.html#/s:9Decompose5Input.abstract: The current position in the Input. Useful for debugging and error messages.

Protocols/Input.html#/s:9Decompose5Input.name: isEmpty
Protocols/Input.html#/s:9Decompose5Input.abstract: Indicates if there are remaining elements available in the view.

Protocols/Input.html#/s:9Decompose5Input.name: current(count:)
Protocols/Input.html#/s:9Decompose5Input.abstract: Returns the current and next count - 1 number of elements.

Protocols/Input.html#/s:9Decompose5Input.name: advanced()
Protocols/Input.html#/s:9Decompose5Input.abstract: Returns an Input which is offset by 1 element.

Protocols/Input.html#/s:9Decompose5Input.name: advanced(by:)
Protocols/Input.html#/s:9Decompose5Input.abstract: Returns an Input which is offset by the specified number of elements.

Protocols/Input.html.name: Input
Protocols/Input.html.abstract: A view for a collection of values.

Functions.html#/s:9Decompose3ggsoiyAA6Pa.abstract: Composes a Parser which invokes the Parser parameter and uses its returned value to invoke the function

Functions.html#/s:9Decompose2ggoiyAA6Par.abstract: Composes a Parser which invokes the Parser parameter and uses its returned value to invoke the function

Functions.html#/s:9Decompose3logoiyAA6Pa.abstract: Returns a Parser which invokes the first Parser, and if it fails, invokes the second Parser.

Functions.html#/s:9Decompose3lmgoiyAA6Pa.abstract: Sequentially invokes two Parsers while applying the second parser’s result into the first parser’s function

Functions.html#/s:9Decompose3lxgoiyAA6Pa.abstract: Maps a Parser‘s value using the function parameter.

Functions.html#/s:9Decompose2mgoiyAA6Par.abstract: Sequentially invokes two Parsers while ignoring the first value.

Functions.html#/s:9Decompose2lmoiyAA6Par.abstract: Sequentially invokes two Parsers while ignoring the second value.

Enums/Reply.html#/s:9Decompose5ReplyO7su.name: success(_:_:_:)
Enums/Reply.html#/s:9Decompose5ReplyO7su.abstract: The parse was successful with the associated return Value, the advanced Input, and a

Enums/Reply.html#/s:9Decompose5ReplyO7me.name: message
Enums/Reply.html#/s:9Decompose5ReplyO7me.abstract: The message to use when a parsing error occurs. For success messages, it can be used as a possibility.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: pure(_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Instantiates a Parser which returns the value parameter and does not advanced the Input.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: bind(_:to:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Composes a Parser which invokes the Parser parameter and uses its returned value to invoke the function

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: then(_:to:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Composes a Parser which invokes the Parser parameter and then invokes the function’s returned Parser.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: satisfy(_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Returns a Parser which passes an element to the condition function and succeeds if the condition returns

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: choice(_:_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Returns a Parser which invokes the first Parser, and if it fails, invokes the second Parser.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: map(_:_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Maps a Parser‘s value using the function parameter.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: apply(_:_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Sequentially invokes two Parsers while invoking the second parser’s result into the first parser’s function.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: label(_:with:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Instantiates a new Parser which will overwrite the parameter Parser‘s ParseMessage’s expectedProductions

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: endOfInput()
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Instantiates a Parser which succeeds if the end of the input is reached.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: char(_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Returns a Parser which tests if the current element is a specific Character.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: letter()
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Returns a Parser which tests if the current element is a letter.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: digit()
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Returns a Parser which tests if the current element is a digit.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: string(_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Returns a Parser which matches a given string.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: stringEmptyReturnValue(_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Returns a Parser which matches a given string. If successful, the returned value is an empty array.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: many(_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Returns a Parser which invokes the parser parameter zero or more times.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: many1(_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Returns a Parser which invokes the parser parameter one or more times.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: skipMany(_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Returns a Parser which discards the return value of the parser parameter zero or more times.

Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.name: skipMany1(_:)
Enums/Combinators.html#/s:9Decompose11Co.abstract: Returns a Parser which discards the return value of the parser parameter one or more times.

Enums/Reply.html.name: Reply
Enums/Reply.html.abstract: A value type which indicates if the function was successful or not.

Enums/ConsumedState.html.name: ConsumedState
Enums/ConsumedState.html.abstract: Indicates whether the Input was advanced or not.

Classes/Consumed.html#/s:9Decompose8Cons.name: state
Classes/Consumed.html#/s:9Decompose8Cons.abstract: Indicates whether the Input was advanced or not when producing this result.

Classes/Consumed.html#/s:9Decompose8Cons.name: reply
Classes/Consumed.html#/s:9Decompose8Cons.abstract: Contains the return state of the function execution.

Classes/Consumed.html#/s:9Decompose8Cons.name: init(_:_:)
Classes/Consumed.html#/s:9Decompose8Cons.abstract: Initializes with the state and an existing Reply value.

Classes/Consumed.html#/s:9Decompose8Cons.name: init(_:_:)
Classes/Consumed.html#/s:9Decompose8Cons.abstract: Initializes with the state and a function which will generate the Reply value.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
